content.text:
This is Ian Axel's new project A Great Big World's version of his song "Say Something".
 http://agreatbigworld.com/
The version appeared on "So You Think You Can Dance" on 9/3/2013.
It's SUUUPER simple in drop d and sounds lovely with a piano backing.

Tuning: Drop D

Chords (DADGBE): B (999---) G (555---) D(000---) A(777---) F#(444---)

[Intro] Ñ…2
[ch]Bm[/ch] [ch]G[/ch] [ch]D[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] 

[Chorus]
[ch]Bm[/ch]                [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]A[/ch] 
  Say something, I'm giving up on you.
[ch]Bm[/ch]              [ch]G[/ch]                  [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]A[/ch] 
  I'll be the one, if you want me to.
[ch]Bm[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]                    [ch]D[/ch]         [ch]A[/ch]
  Anywhere, I would've followed you.
[ch]Bm[/ch]                [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]A[/ch] 
  Say something, I'm giving up on you.

[Verse]  
    [ch]D[/ch]                [ch]F#m[/ch]            
And I am feeling so small.
        [ch]G[/ch]
It was over my head
                  [ch]D[/ch]     [ch]A[/ch]
I know nothing at all.
    [ch]D[/ch]                   [ch]F#m[/ch]  
And I will stumble and fall.
            [ch]G[/ch]
I'm still learning to love
                 [ch]D[/ch]     [ch]A[/ch]
Just starting to crawl.

[Chorus]
[ch]Bm[/ch]                 [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]A[/ch] 
   Say something, I'm giving up on you.
[ch]Bm[/ch]                 [ch]G[/ch]                  [ch]D[/ch]     [ch]A[/ch] 
   I'm sorry that I couldn't get to you.
[ch]Bm[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]      [ch]A[/ch]
   Anywhere, I will follow you.
[ch]Bm[/ch]                 [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]A[/ch] 
   Say something, I'm giving up on you.

[Verse]
    [ch]D[/ch]                  [ch]F#m[/ch]  
And I will swallow my pride.
            [ch]G[/ch]
You're the one that I love
                   [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]A[/ch]
And I'm saying goodbye.

[Chorus]
[ch]Bm[/ch]                [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]A[/ch] 
  Say something, I'm giving up on you.
[ch]Bm[/ch]              [ch]G[/ch]                  [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]A[/ch]

[ch]Bm[/ch]                [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch] 
Say something...

RH - D drones quarter notes throughout

D (root)

D (root)
A (1st inversion: C# - E - A)

content.text:
This tab is an easier to play version of the ones already out there.
It is easier to play because you basically just have to move two fingers throughout the verse.
Also, this version incorporates the ringing "d" from the piano, 
making it sound a bit more advanced.

content.text:
Nuclear Cowboys in an Age of Drift - Against Me!

Tabbed by: Tux D-Lux
Email: tuxluvv@drexel.edu

Tuning: Standard (EADGBe)

Most of the song is played on 3 chords:

    [ch]B[/ch]           [ch]Gm[/ch]         [ch]F#[/ch]/[ch]Gb[/ch]

e|---2---|  e|---3---|  e|---2---|
B|---4---|  B|---3---|  B|---2---|
G|---4---|  G|---3---|  G|---3---|
D|---4---|  D|---5---|  D|---4---|
A|---2---|  A|---5---|  A|---4---|
E|---x---|  E|---3---|  E|---2---|

During the middle and at the end, he switches to these higher chords:

     [ch]D[/ch]           [ch]A[/ch]           [ch]E[/ch]

e|---5---|  e|---5---|  e|---7---|
B|---7---|  B|---5---|  B|---9---|
G|---7---|  G|---6---|  G|---9---|
D|---7---|  D|---7---|  D|---9---|
A|---5---|  A|---7---|  A|---7---|
E|---x---|  E|---5---|  E|---x---|

If the notes sound a little off or the movements are too hard, play them like power chords.
I'm pretty sure Tom does it that way anyway.

The strumming rhythms are pretty easy to pick up so I'll leave those outm but before he 
the entire chord, he taps the first note.

For example, the beginning would be:

   [ch]B[/ch]             [ch]Gm[/ch]             [ch]F#[/ch]/[ch]Gb[/ch]

e|------2---|  e|----3---|  e|----2---|
B|------4---|  B|----3---|  B|----2---|
G|------4---|  G|----3---|  G|----3---|
D|------4---|  D|----5---|  D|----4---|
A|-0-2--2---|  A|----5---|  A|----4---|
E|------x---|  E|-3--3---|  E|-2--2---|

Intro:  [ch]B[/ch] [ch]Gm[/ch] [ch]F#[/ch] (x2)

  [ch]B[/ch]           [ch]Gm[/ch]                     [ch]F#[/ch]
This is the dumbest movie that I've ever seen

[ch]B[/ch]                [ch]Gm[/ch]
The outcome is predictable

[ch]F#[/ch]                                    [ch]B[/ch]
And the casting is so obvious and transparent

[ch]Gm[/ch]      [ch]F#[/ch]
Acting transparent politicians

[ch]B[/ch]                         [ch]Gm[/ch]                [ch]F#[/ch]
And with out without your vote, well the election's going to happen


[ch]Gm[/ch]                                             [ch]B[/ch]
I know it burns in your stomach to feel so cheated

[ch]Gm[/ch]                                         [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]       [ch]E[/ch]
It burns in your stomach to feel there's nothing you can do about it

[ch]D[/ch]                       [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
So we laugh together in the same cynical way

[ch]D[/ch]                       [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
And we'll talk about it in the same beaten-down way

[ch]Gm[/ch]                [ch]B[/ch]
And nothing changes


      [Interlude]              [B x 3 1/2]

e|---------------------------------2----------------------------------------|
B|---------------------------------4----------------------------------------|
G|---------------------------------4----------------------------------------|
D|---------------------------------4----------------------------------------|
A|--9--7--5--4--7--5--4--0---------2--------0~------------------------------|
E|---------------------------------x----------------------------------------|
                                            ^
                          Halfway through the 4th Strumming rhythm,
                                 stop and hit the open A (hard)


[ch]B[/ch]            [ch]Gm[/ch]                         [ch]F#[/ch]
These are the same choices that we've always had

[ch]B[/ch]             [ch]Gm[/ch]
It's the same rhetoric

[ch]F#[/ch]
It's the same campaign promises

      [ch]B[/ch]                      [ch]Gm[/ch]        [ch]F#[/ch]
Oh, you don't have to buy what they're selling

     [ch]B[/ch]                         [ch]Gm[/ch]              [ch]F#[/ch]
But with or without your vote, one of these candidates will take office

[ch]Gm[/ch]                              [ch]B[/ch]
And everybody's praying to go numb

[ch]Gm[/ch]
Everybody's got the same excuses

[ch]D[/ch]                 [ch]A[/ch]                 [ch]E[/ch]
There's nothing they can do about it

[ch]D[/ch]                       [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
So we laugh together in the same cynical way

[ch]D[/ch]                       [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
And We'll talk about it in the same beaten-down way

[ch]D[/ch]                       [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
Yeah, we laugh together in the same cynical way

[ch]D[/ch]                       [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
And we talk about it in the same beaten-down way

[ch]Gm[/ch]
And nothing changes

                  [ch]B[/ch]
Nothing ever changes


END:
                                   [ch]B[/ch]  [ch]B[/ch]  [ch]B[/ch]

B|---------------------------------4--4--4---|

                                   ^  ^  ^

And there you have it.
